ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: MM Drum misadventure and Nostrolo Tamborine
ygData.msgSnippet: The kaesora coin ================= Not that hard to get. I have 3 or 4 of them. The failed crypt raider drops the coin, and seems to drop it every time. He
ygData.messageBody:
The kaesora coin
=================
Not that hard to get. I have 3 or 4 of them.

The failed crypt raider drops the coin, and seems to drop it every time. He
spawns near the library. Getting to the library is laughably easy. You can
pull singles or doubles the whole way there just by pulling slowly and
carefully, no lulling is needed. The raider seems to be on approx a 40 min
spawn, which is about twice the regular spawn rate of the dungeon.

Scrounger coin
===============
Scrounger happened to be there one day as I was passing through. I soloed
him easily despite the 2 sarnak knights that joined in. (selo, chant, chant)

Dalnir Coin
============
PAIN IN THE BUTT to get.

The imprecator is not a common spawn. I spent 3 hours in dalnir before he
showed. We were camping the church, but the 2 times he spawned, he spawned
in the upstairs location. (2nd level) A druid was at the upstairs spot, so
we went up there and I bought the coin for 50p. (which is what I had on me)

Bloodgill Coin
===============
dunno, bought if from a merchant for 6 silver. :┬¼ )

City of Mist Coin
==================
Captain of the guard spawns near the entrance. You need to clear 1-4 mobs
before you can pull him. He drops the coin everytime. I have 3 or 4 of these
as well, and saw many others go to party members.

Emerald Forest
===============
All luck. Our druid foraged it on the first try. (whoo hoo)

Star of Odus
=============
Approx 105 p. Can be purchased in Erudin or East Cabalis.

That's all there was to it for me. Got my tamborine and am loving every
second of it.

Drae




-----Original Message-----
From: blitz_krieg@... [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
Sent: Friday, June 09, 2000 4:17 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: MM Drum misadventure and Nostrolo Tamborine


I paid 5 pp for the foraged one (The guy said to give him whatever..
I felt like a cheapskate, but it was all the money I had in the world
at the time.. I'll probably find him and give him some more money at
some point) and 50 pp for the coin in Kaesora. The guy in Kaesora
was very helpful in telling me how difficult it would be to get the
coins and (from what he said) that specific coin was pretty rare, so
I felt it was worth more. The one's in Dalnir I got for free.

Prices could vary tremendously, I imagine, but remember that the
person you're dealing with can not complete the quest (unless they
are a Bard, have a Bard, or know a Bard). I always offer to pay in
my shout to the zone and then leave it up to the person who offers to
decide how much they want for it. Most people don't know what
they're for and are actually happy to give it away for free when you
tell them (MENTION THAT IT'S NO DROP!!!!). And most people would
have destroyed it anyway, so ANY money is more than they'd get
otherwise.

Darkfox Reven'tsol
Xegony


> Speaking of these coins, if you had to buy them, how much would you
expect
> to pay for them?
>
> Gilgurth
